snippet: At least 89 people were killed in a huge explosion at the market in Paktika Province, officials said. The Taliban, the main suspects, denied responsibility.
abstract: Sport utility vehicle packed with explosives detonates in market in eastern Afghanistan, killing at least 89 people, one of the deadliest terrorist attacks in country since 2001; suspicion immediately falls upon the Taliban, which denies responsibility.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and FAROOQ JAN MANGAL
byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib, Hares Kakar and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: At least 89 people were killed in a huge explosion at the market in Paktika Province, officials said. The Taliban, the main suspects, denied responsibility.

headline.main: Scores Killed in Car Bombing at Busy Market in Eastern Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Scores Killed in Car Bombing at Busy Market in Eastern Afghanistan
